DLV
Class Predicate.Fact

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--DLV.Predicate.Fact
Enclosing class:
Predicate
public class Predicate.Fact
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents facts. A fact in a logic database is like a tuple in a relational database.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Francesco Ricca

Constructor Detail

Predicate.Fact

public Predicate.Fact()
Constructs a (positive) fact of arity 0. This is an abbreviation for Fact(new String[]{})

Throws:
BadArityException - if fact arity differs from the arity of this Predicate.

Predicate.Fact

public Predicate.Fact(boolean positive)
Constructs a fact of arity 0. The fact built will be a positive fact if "positive" is true, negative otherwise. This is an abbreviation for Fact(new String[]{},positive) This constructor is useful when true negation is used.

Parameters:
positive - A boolean variable which indicate that the fact is positive or negative.
Throws:
BadArityException - if fact arity differs from the arity of this Predicate.

Predicate.Fact

public Predicate.Fact(java.lang.String[] term)
Constructs a (positive) fact from an array of terms.

Parameters:
term - Is an array of String objects which contains terms.
Throws:
BadArityException - if fact arity differs from the arity of this Predicate.

Predicate.Fact

public Predicate.Fact(java.lang.String[] term,
                      boolean positive)
Constructs a fact from an array of terms. The fact built will be a positive fact if "positive" is true, negative otherwise. This constructor is useful when true negation is used.

Parameters:
term - Is an array of String objects which contains terms.
positive - A boolean variable which indicate that the fact is positive or negative.
Throws:
BadArityException - if fact arity differs from the arity of this Predicate.
Method Detail

getPredicate

public Predicate getPredicate()
This function returns the Predicate object which contains this fact. (From a relational point of view this function returns the table which contains this tuple).

Returns:
The Predicate object which contains this fact.

name

public java.lang.String name()
Returns the name of the Predicate which contains this fact.

Returns:
name of the Predicate which contains this fact.

arity

public int arity()
Returns the arity of the Predicate which contains this fact.

Returns:
The arity of the Predicate which contains this fact.

getTermAt

public java.lang.String getTermAt(int i)
This function returns the i-th term of this fact. (From a relational point of view this function returns the value conatined in the i-th position of this tuple).

Returns:
The i-th term of this fact.
Throws:
NoSuchTermException - if you try to get a term which doesn't exist.

setTermAt

public void setTermAt(java.lang.String t,
                      int i)
This function sets the i-th term of this fact. (From a relational point of view this function sets the value conatined in the i-th position of this tuple).

Throws:
NoSuchTermException - if you try to modify a term which doesn't exist.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if t is null.

isPositive

public boolean isPositive()
Returns true if this fact is positive. This method is useful if the logic program uses true negation.

Returns:
Returns true if this fact is positive.

invert

public void invert()
If this fact is positive this method make it negative and vice versa. This method modify the current Fact and also the Predicate object P which contains it. If a contrary Fact object is contained in P yet, it will be removed. Be cautious using this method you may cause inconsistencies in logic programs! Be cautious using this method you may cause inconsistencies in multithread programs!

getContrary

public Predicate.Fact getContrary()
Gets the contrary fact. If the Predicate object which contains this Fact contains the contrary this method returns it, otherwise it creates and returns a new Fact object which is the Contrary of this. The new object isn't inserted in the predicate.

isContrary

public boolean isContrary(Predicate.Fact f)
If this fact is the contrary of f returns true, otherwise false.

Parameters:
f - a Fact object.
Returns:
true if this fact is the contrary of f, otherwise false.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if f is null.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
If this fact is the same of f returns true, otherwise false. Two Fact are equals if they are:
- the same object
or
- part of the same Predicate, both positive (or negative) and they have the same terms.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
true if this fact is the same of f, otherwise false.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if f is null.
